newsitem.title: USA: IPO HIGHLIGHTS - Vision, Clearview open.
newsitem.headline: IPO HIGHLIGHTS - Vision, Clearview open.

text.p: A movie theatre chain and a company that provides services to eye care networks made their market debuts on Tuesday with small initial public offerings, raising a combined $29 million.

-- Vision Twenty-One Inc shares eked out a small gain, up 1/8 to 10-1/8. It raised $21 million (before paying underwriting and other fees) by selling about 25 percent of its equity to the public in the offering. The 2.1 million shares were sold for $10 each by underwriter Prudential Securities, below price talk of $11 to $13.

Vision provides managed care to local groups of eyecare providers, like optometrists, clinics, ophthalmologists and retail eyewear sellers. It reported net losses in 1994, 1995, 1996 and the first quarter of 1997, according to its prospectus, and had an accumulated deficit of $8.1 million.

-- Clearview Cinema Group Inc shares posted early gains, up 1-1/4 to 9-1/4. Shares were priced at $8, the low end of an estimated range of $8 to $10, by lead underwriter Prime Charter Ltd. Prime Charter has an over-allotment option on up to 150,000 shares.
The Madison, N.J., movie theatre chain sold all of the one million shares offered. It operates 69 screens in 17 multiplex theaters in "affluent suburban communities" in the New York and New Jersey.
Kalb Voorhis & Co/HYY Securities will be the specialist unit for Vision, according to the American Stock Exchange.
